text: (bright music)
(Ana speaking foreign language)
(Vanessa speaking foreign language)
(Bruno speaking foreign language)
(Allan speaking foreign language)
- We are here in Sao Paulo.
This is the largest city in Brazil,

and in a lot of aspects,
the most important one,
most vibrant one, the most diverse one.

- In Brazil, we have a culture
of being very creative.

This is something that the
Brazilian respect about itself,

because frugal in Brazil is not
a thing that you can choose,
it's something that you need to do.

My name is Bruno Nunes. I'm
CEO and founder of Base39.
At Base39, we work with generative AI

to help companies to take
better decisions with credit.

It's not just about
offering money for everyone,

but actually making the right
decision for each individual.

I have been using AWS
for the last 10 years,

and I'm very evangelist
about the technology.

I think one of the most important
things with generative AI
is how fast we can go.

If AWS can provide us
the basis of this thing

to keep it running, we can
focus on the differentials
so we can actually take care of
and deliver value for our customers.

- Of course, people
are really hardworking,

but that's true in in
other cities as well.

Sao Paulo, in a way, we're
perhaps able to have a good time
in the path more than other places.
Yeah, we're having more fun. (laughs)

I'm Allan Paladino. I'm the
CEO and co-founder of Lastro.

We're a startup that
develops this AI assistant
for real estate brokerages.
We're at Faria Lima Avenue in Sao Paulo.
I used to make this route every day

when I started my career
coming out of college

and going to the investment
bank where I used to work,

and nowadays we have, here
at Lastro, a lot of people

from the team and interns
who go to the same college,

and they'll be doing the
same route every day,
but they're not going to a bank,
they're going to a tech startup,
and this already tells the story

about the tech community
here in Sao Paulo, I think.

- Here in Sao Paulo, you
have a lot of tech companies,
startups, financial industry,

but then you also have
really good restaurants,
really interesting bars.
This is where things are happening.
- I love this neighborhood,

because even being a
huge city like Sao Paulo,

you still can see people smiling
to each other, connecting.

My name is Vanessa Santos,
and I'm an AWS Community Hero.
I see this role, just an outcome
of being passionate about technology,
passionate about enabling people
to develop more hard skills

to solve the right problems
around my community.

I want to be the person
that will keep giving

that kind of incentive to
the next generation coming,
and with that passion, with that fire,
to build a better place for themselves
and also for their communities.
We usually struggle to find a place
in which we can call home,

but having a location
like the AWS Gen AI Loft,
it was amazing.
- [Bruno] I really like to go there,

because we met a lot of
VCs and a lot of startups

and also customers, so
it's a very rich place.

- [Allan] When generative
AI started to grow

as a technology, I remember
seeing people in San Francisco

doing those hacker
houses, and it really had
this kind of early days of internet vibe.
I remember clearly, I felt some FOMO.

Now that you have spaces
like the Gen AI Loft

here in Sao Paulo, I think
that kind of fills that space.
Startups have a lot of problems to solve,

and you really need the best
people that really resonates

with this culture of
being a city of outsiders,
and I think that's maybe a key theme
of the developer community in Sao Paulo,
and that's why Sao Paulo has been able

to grow its tech community
so much in the last years.
